pr_title: Move non application endpoints to separate URL path

timeline.bodyText:
So, does that mean that Framework is equivalent to NonApplication?
Can't we have a single word?
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I kind of flip flopped between them.
Leaning towards "NonApplication". If that's preferred I can align them all
replies.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText: Yes, I actually prefer avoiding the word "framework"
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: How about Core?
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Um, actually I think something like management would make more sense
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
management implies you can actually manage something, which isn't the case with these endpoints.
I've changed it to "NonApplication"
replies.author: kenfinnigan

timeline.bodyText:
Why does swagger-ui stay on the main router?
I understand it's an asset, but that looks not totally right.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
My reasoning, for now, is it's a Dev/Test extension only.
Happy to revise either now or in future if that's the preferred approach
replies.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText: it's dev mode only because it was exposed on the public internet. But if we fix that "small" issue, it might be very useful even in prod.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Fair enough, I can move to "non app" as well
replies.author: kenfinnigan

timeline.bodyText:
That only configure the "/q".
Don't you want to allow having a separate HTTP server (maybe it's done somewhere else)
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: I've created #13602 to handle the port and binding options to keep this PR simple and get it in
replies.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText: ah ok!
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText:
So, we have /quarkus for the console and /q for framework.
I may be wrong but I don't believe the console should be "application".
Also, all guides, workshops and quickstarts would need an update once this is merged
timeline.author: cescoffier
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -35,4 +35,13 @@
      */
     @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "/quarkus")
     public String consolePath;
+
+    /**
+     * The HTTP root path for framework endpoints. Various endpoints such as metrics, health,
+     * and open api are deployed under this path.
+     * Setting the value to "/" disables the separate framework root,
+     * resulting in all framework endpoints being served from "/" along with the application.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "/q")
+    public String frameworkRootPath;

replies.bodyText:
Is that the new dev console that was created as part of Reactive Resteasy? Did that get merged already, might have missed it.
If it's in, would /q/console be ok?
Should the guides be updated as part of this PR?
replies.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText: I let @FroMage @stuartwdouglas and @geoand decide.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: The console started out as part of RESTEasy Reactive, but is now in a separate (not yet merged) branch. The console currently is under /@dev.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: Who decided on the /q default prefix? Isn't it likely to conflict with user paths?
replies.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: It was agreed a few weeks ago in a team meeting, but not set in stone
replies.author: kenfinnigan

replies.bodyText:
I guess I would have made it /@q to make sure it didn't conflict. But if everyone prefers /q let's go with that.
As for the dev console it should move to /q/dev if we do that.
replies.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText:
I think @ is reserved for a special meaning within a scheme (eg.
https://foo:bar@example.com)
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: But looking at the URL RFC I see that @ is accepted as part of the URL path, so I dunno 😃
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: It's only reserved as part of the authority section (host name).
replies.author: FroMage

timeline.bodyText: Should we consider updating the TCKs to allows setting the prefix?
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Some TCKs explicitly indicate the name of the URL path, sometimes in relation to root context, so I don't think this would be possible
replies.author: kenfinnigan

timeline.message:
- Adds documentation updates
- Includes Swagger UI under the new non application endpoint path
- Changes names to refer to "NonApplication" instead of Framework

Move non application endpoints to separate URL path

- Fixes #13144
- OpenAPI, Metrics, Micrometer, Health, Health UI endpoints are all now served under /q by default
- Previous behavior can be attained by setting `quarkus.http.framework-root-path` to `/`

Subsequent issue will be created for handling port and binding changes for non application endpoints
Fix some more url references in tests found from CI

- Adds documentation updates
- Includes Swagger UI under the new non application endpoint path
- Changes names to refer to "NonApplication" instead of Framework
Forgot I fixed this test in GH UI last week
Missed a couple of Swagger UI path usages
Add HTTP Redirect from current path to new non application endpoint root path
Add HTTP Redirect from current path to new non application endpoint root path

- Add ability to disable redirect of non application endpoints to non application root path
- Renamed property for defining non application root path to no longer use "framework"

timeline.author: ebullient

replies.bodyText: I think httpBuildTimeConfig.redirectToNonApplicationRootPath came in while I was reviewing .. ;)
replies.author: ebullient

timeline.bodyText:
This is one of the only places w/o the leading '/' ...
while it may work, the inconsistency is noticable
timeline.author: ebullient
